short_summary: Stabilize and repair the highway 93S embankment to prevent future erosion.
description: The objective of this project is to stabilize and repair the highway 93S embankment to prevent future erosion. The project work includes supply and placement of rip-rap armouring, geotextile, grading, seeding, and other related works along Highway 93S near km 52 & km 86, in Kootenay National Park (KNP), British Columbia. Work below the high-water mark must be completed between August 16th and August 31st. Only qualified suppliers have been invited to bid.

full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement
#### Stage 2 - Hwy 93S Erosion Repair - Kootenay National Park
#### Reference Number: cb-741-17011209
#### Solicitation Number: 5P468-24-0016/A

#### Notice Information

*   Publication Date: June 18, 2024
*   Tender Closing Date: July 3, 2024, at 16:00:00
*   Expected Contract Start Date: May 3, 2024
*   Expected Contract End Date: September 30, 2024

#### Technical Details

The Canadian government has published a request for proposal (RFP) for Stage 2 of the Hwy 93S Erosion Repair project in Kootenay National Park. The project involves stabilizing and repairing the highway 93S embankment to prevent future erosion.

Key project requirements include:

*   Supply and placement of rip-rap armouring
*   Geotextile installation
*   Grading and seeding
*   Other related works

Specifically, the work must be completed between August 16th and August 31st

#### Selection Process

This RFP is part of a two-stage solicitation process:

1.  **Stage 1: Qualification Evaluation**: Interested suppliers evaluated their qualifications.
2.  **Stage 2: Bid Invitation**: Qualified suppliers invited to provide further qualifications and a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings.

Only qualified suppliers have been invited to bid.

#### Contracting Information

*   Contracting Entity: Parks Canada
*   Contact Information:
    *   Name: Kelly Nuevo
    *   Email: kelly.nuevo@pc.gc.ca
    *   Phone: (204) 430-7356

#### Trade Agreements

*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

RFP documents and related information are not available online. Suppliers who have been invited to bid should contact Kelly Nuevo for more information and to request the RFP package.   


(Note: I included the specific modifications you requested, formatting as well as added section headings.)
